metadata.title: CVE-2022-26490 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
st21nfca_connectivity_event_received in drivers/nfc/st21nfca/se.c in theLinux kernel through 5.16.12 has EVT_TRANSACTION buffer overflows becauseof untrusted length parameters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1042-dell300x - 4.15.0-1042.47
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1071-gke - 5.4.0-1071.76~18.04.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1040-gkeop - 5.4.0-1040.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1109.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1127-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1127.136
No subscription required
